data.title: Mental Health Breakthroughs For Young Adults & Families : Carey Conley: Amazon.com.au: Audible Books & Originals
data.meta_description: Mental Health Breakthroughs For Young Adults & Families : Carey Conley: Amazon.com.au: Audible Books & Originals
data.text:
Send us a Text Message.

In this enlightening episode, Alex Wassom shares his journey and the profound challenges faced by young men in our generation. He emphasizes the importance of identifying one's purpose and reflecting on personal goals. Alex discusses the critical role of self-care and learning from failure to achieve mental clarity. He also tackles the detrimental effects of negative self-talk and how to dismantle these harmful beliefs to discover true self-worth.

Alex Wassom is a dedicated husband to his high school sweetheart, whom he's known since kindergarten, and a proud father to three daughters and a son. His mission is to make the world a better place by helping individuals become their best selves.

In his late teens and early twenties, Alex confronted suicidal depression, which sparked a transformative 15-year journey of self-mastery. His experiences have equipped him with the insights needed to guide others in unlocking their fullest potential. Alex aims to share his hard-earned wisdom to help others avoid his mistakes and accelerate their journey toward personal fulfillment.

Holding an economics degree, Alex has worked with Fortune 500 tech companies, partner organizations, and in managed services and cloud computing. He has managed pipelines worth hundreds of millions, closed multi-million dollar deals, earned a place in the president’s club, led teams, and developed impactful Go-To-Market strategies. Today, he leverages this extensive experience to help others thrive.

https://www.alexwassom.com/

This episode emphasizes the critical importance of changing one's mindset regarding money, shifting from negative to abundant thinking about finances. It encourages viewers to view money as an "employee" capable of generating more wealth and explores various strategies to make money work for them. The discussion highlights the potential for financial improvement regardless of current circumstances, providing inspiring examples of individuals overcoming significant debt by making decisive changes to their financial status.

In the podcast episode "The Path To Achieving Financial Freedom with Sharon Lechter," Sharon recounts her early life and the pivotal experiences that shaped her career, including serving two presidents and holding significant roles. She highlights the profound influence of her parents on her financial literacy and the lessons learned. Sharon discusses the mentality surrounding money, spending, and the impact of social media on comparison and control. She offers insights on the harmful effects of negative thoughts and statements, advising listeners on how to manage their finances wisely, particularly for young individuals seeking financial freedom.

Sharon Lechter is a globally recognized expert in financial literacy, keynote speaker, and business mentor with a distinguished 35-year career as a licensed CPA. A New York Times bestselling author and successful entrepreneur, she has made significant contributions to the field of financial education. Sharon has advised two US Presidents on financial literacy, highlighting her influence beyond the business realm. She co-authored the international bestseller "Rich Dad Poor Dad" and 14 other books in the Rich Dad series. During the 2008 economic downturn, she partnered with the Napoleon Hill Foundation to rejuvenate Napoleon Hill's teachings, resulting in bestselling titles like "Three Feet from Gold," "Outwitting the Devil," and "Think and Grow Rich for Women." Sharon also stars in the film "Think and Grow Rich: The Legacy" and the TV series "World's Greatest Motivators." Her latest book, "Exit Rich," provides entrepreneurs with strategies to enhance their business value and scalability. Sharon Lechter's dedication to financial education and empowerment continues to inspire individuals worldwide.

https://www.facebook.com/AuthorSharonLechter

https://www.instagram.com/sharonlechter/

https://www.linkedin.com/in/sharonlechter/

http://www.twitter.com/sharonlechter

In this podcast episode, Carey Conley discusses her deeply personal experience of losing her husband and 25-year-old son to suicide. She co-authored the book "Keep Looking Up" with her daughter in 2019, which explores the lessons learned and coping strategies. The episode highlights different approaches to healing, with her daughter choosing therapy and group sessions, while Carey found solace in quiet time and introspection. Emphasizing the importance of personal healing methods, Carey discusses building inner strength, encouraging listeners to view challenges as opportunities for personal growth and resilience.

In the podcast episode "You Are Destined For More with Brandon Hintz," Brandon shares the profound impact of faith in his life and how it has guided him. He discusses his early realizations and how he became in tune with his testimony, leading to a deeper understanding of his potential. Brandon emphasizes the importance of perseverance, building oneself for the future, and recognizing that challenges will pass, reinforcing the belief that we are not meant to navigate life alone.

Brandon Hintz, is Husband, Father, Coach and the founder of The NOW Academy, dedicated to empowering individuals to achieve extraordinary results in their personal and professional lives.

As the host of the High Impact Coach Program, Brandon combines personalized coaching sessions, cutting-edge strategies, and a supportive community to catalyze significant positive changes. His expertise and passion for personal development guide participants through self-discovery, helping them overcome limiting beliefs, develop clear goals, and implement actionable steps to achieve their dreams.

Brandon’s mission is to provide structure, support, and accountability for meaningful and sustainable success, inviting individuals to join the community and unlock their full potential.

http://www.BrandonHintz.com

https://www.facebook.com/BrandonHintzlife

This podcast episode delves into the concept of mental toughness and its critical role in overcoming life challenges. It emphasizes the importance of developing resilience from an early age and how mental toughness can guide individuals through adversity. Key strategies for building mental toughness include honest self-assessment, writing out feelings, and confronting hard truths. The episode addresses common tendencies to provide expected answers instead of honest ones and highlights the significance of being coachable for personal growth and development. Listeners are encouraged to embrace these practices to enhance their mental resilience and achieve personal success.

In this episode of "Mental Health Breakthroughs for Young Adults & Families," guest Robert Owens discusses the importance of finding structure and embracing humility. He emphasizes that significant change often comes from a place of desperation, where altering influences and building a supportive structure become essential. Owens provides insights on identifying the right type of structure for individual needs and highlights the detrimental effects of handling pressure alone without seeking help. He shares practical tools for young adults to manage their mental health effectively and underscores the value of walking with humility and asking for guidance to navigate life's challenges successfully.

Robert Hamilton Owens, known as "The Fittest and Mentally Toughest 71-Year-Old in the World," embodies resilience and dedication across a spectrum of endeavors. Born and raised in Orange County, California, Robert’s journey from a special-needs child to a U.S. Air Force Special Ops Pararescueman highlights his tenacity. He triumphed over physical limitations to excel in competitive swimming and later, in grueling Ironman Triathlons across the globe. As an Air Force Pararescueman, Robert performed heroic rescues and later undertook humanitarian missions into the Soviet Union. He has completed 12 Ironman Triathlons and even the "World Marathon Challenge," which involves running seven marathons on seven continents in seven days. A sought-after motivational speaker and philanthropist, Robert continues to inspire with his commitment to pushing physical and mental boundaries, while helping others realize their potential. Whether addressing elite athletes or global leaders, Robert's life lessons in resilience continue to motivate and inspire audiences worldwide.

https://www.roberthamiltonowens.com/

https://www.linkedin.com/in/robert-hamilton-owens-6a6a9493/

https://www.instagram.com/roberthamiltonowens/?hl=en

In the latest episode of "Mental Health Breakthroughs for Young Adults and Families," host Carey Conley interviews Albert Chavez about mending his relationship with his father and finding balance between action and learning. The discussion emphasizes the importance of focusing on strengths, understanding one's purpose, and the power of collaboration. Albert's inspiring journey with his father is also featured on their podcast, The Legacy Project. Listeners are encouraged to download the free e-book "Vision is Victory" for additional guidance on achieving clarity and personal growth.
